titleStmt.title: D. H. London to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2324

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: His Excellency Gov. Peirpoint of this State having appointed me a Notary Public for this City & County, I respectfully ask the appointment of Commissioner for your State to take acknowledgements of deeds &c in this city.
I flatter myself I can with confidence refer your Excellency to anyone who may know me for my faithfulness in all matters of trust or business and if necessary will forward recommendations.

His Excellency
the Governor of Kentucky
Frankfort.

His Excellency
The Govenor
Frankfort
Kentucky

Comr of Deeds
Virginia
D H, London
Comd
26th Dec/65
